intro: Hopea mindanensis, commonly known as Mindanao hopea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Dipterocarpaceae. It is native to the Philippines, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Mindanao. The plant is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 40 meters tall, characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically yellowish-green in color, and it produces woody fruits containing one or two seeds. Hopea mindanensis is valued for its durable timber and is also important in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
